command.elements

Class GraphicElementInvoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • command.elements.GraphicElementInvoker

  • public class GraphicElementInvoker
extends java.lang.Object
    Command invoker for graphic element related commands, supporting undo and redo with a fixed maximum history size. It can also keep track of an edit session and remove its commands from the undo history if the session is cancelled.
    Author:
    geomaster

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GraphicElementInvoker getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of GraphicElementInvoker.
        Returns:
        Instance

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(GraphicElementCommand command)
        Executes a command and records it in the undo history.
        Parameters:
        command - Command to execute

      • registerUndoRedoStatusListener

        public void registerUndoRedoStatusListener(UndoRedoStatusListener listener)
        Registers an undo/redo status listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to register

      • unregisterUndoRedoStatusListener

        public void unregisterUndoRedoStatusListener(UndoRedoStatusListener listener)
        Unregisters a previously registered undo/redo status listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to unregister

      • canUndo

        public boolean canUndo()
        Checks if undo is currently possible. Undo is not possible iff there are no previous commands in the history.
        Returns:
        true if undo is currently possible, false if not

      • canRedo

        public boolean canRedo()
        Checks if redo is currently possible. Redo is not possible iff undo was never done or if commands have been executed since the last undo operation or if there are no newer commands than the last redone command.
        Returns:
        true if undo is currently possible, false if not

      • startSession

        public void startSession()
        Starts a session. All commands from hereafter will be kept track of and can be removed from the undo history using abortSession().

      • abortSession

        public void abortSession()
        Aborts a session previously started using startSession(). All commands executed since startSession() will be removed from history, and the state of the invoker will be reverted to the one immediately preceeding the startSession() call.

      • undoCommand

        public void undoCommand()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Undoes the last command.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the command throws an exception during the undoing

      • redoCommand

        public void redoCommand()
        Redoes the last undone command.
